data-scroll-anchor="false"><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT said:</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="e1b6ad58-1d65-4ac7-afbe-ac7a766df2bc" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4-1-mini"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="24">Dang, persistent one! 😅</p>
<p data-start="26" data-end="95">Since <code data-start="32" data-end="44">WinError 6</code> still hits on <code data-start="59" data-end="67">Ctrl+C</code>, here’s a quick workaround:</p>
<hr data-start="97" data-end="100">
<h3 data-start="102" data-end="166">Quick fix to <strong data-start="119" data-end="149">force-terminate CMD script</strong> if Ctrl+C fails:</h3>
<ol data-start="168" data-end="577">
<li data-start="168" data-end="258">
<p data-start="171" data-end="258"><strong data-start="171" data-end="195">Press <code data-start="179" data-end="193">Ctrl + Break</code></strong> (sometimes <code data-start="207" data-end="214">Pause</code> key on keyboard) — works on some keyboards.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="260" data-end="505">
<p data-start="263" data-end="281">If no <code data-start="269" data-end="276">Break</code> key:</p>
<ul data-start="286" data-end="505">
<li data-start="286" data-end="313">
<p data-start="288" data-end="313">Open a <strong data-start="295" data-end="313">new CMD window</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="317" data-end="376">
<p data-start="319" data-end="323">Run:</p>

<li data-start="380" data-end="418">
<p data-start="382" data-end="418">Find the Python process PID (number)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="422" data-end="505">
<p data-start="424" data-end="448">Then force kill it with:</p>

</li>
<li data-start="507" data-end="577">
<p data-start="510" data-end="577">Or just close the CMD window manually by clicking the close button.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="579" data-end="582">
<p data-start="584" data-end="690">If you want, I can help adjust your script to avoid any freezing or infinite loops to prevent this hassle.</p>

<h3 data-start="191" data-end="259">Here's a simpler way to avoid that error and still run smoothly:</h3>
<p data-start="261" data-end="413">Instead of redirecting <code data-start="284" data-end="296">sys.stdout</code> and <code data-start="301" data-end="313">sys.stderr</code>, <strong data-start="315" data-end="362">just avoid any <code data-start="332" data-end="341">print()</code> or <code data-start="345" data-end="354">input()</code> calls</strong> altogether — run a clean minimal script like this:</p>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> time

driver = uc.Chrome()
driver.get(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://www.google.com"</span></span><span>)
time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>)
driver.quit()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="566" data-end="569">
<h3 data-start="571" data-end="606">Extra tips to avoid this error:</h3>
<ul data-start="608" data-end="896">
<li data-start="608" data-end="736">
<p data-start="610" data-end="736">Run your script from a <strong data-start="633" data-end="663">standard CMD or PowerShell</strong>, <strong data-start="665" data-end="693">not inside IDE terminals</strong> like PyCharm or VSCode integrated console.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="737" data-end="806">
<p data-start="739" data-end="806">Make sure your <strong data-start="754" data-end="805">Python and ChromeDriver versions are compatible</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="807" data-end="896">
<p data-start="809" data-end="896">Avoid <code data-start="815" data-end="824">input()</code>, <code data-start="826" data-end="835">print()</code>, or any calls that write to console while Chrome is running.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="898" data-end="901">
<h3 data-start="903" data-end="940">Want to safely test with logging?</h3>
<p data-start="942" data-end="996">If you want logs, write to a file instead of printing:</p>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> undetected_chromedriver </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> uc
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> time

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">with</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">open</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"log.txt"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"a"</span></span><span>) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> f:
    f.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Browser closed.\n"</span></span><span>)

10.667V12.665ZM18.165 9.33301C18.165 10.022 18.1657 10.5791 18.1289 11.0293C18.0961 11.4302 18.0311 11.7914 17.8867 12.1279L17.8203 12.2705C17.5549 12.7914 17.1509 13.2272 16.6553 13.5313L16.4365 13.6533C16.0599 13.8452 15.6541 13.9245 15.1963 13.9619C14.8593 13.9895 14.4624 13.9935 13.9951 13.9951C13.9935 14.4624 13.9895 14.8593 13.9619 15.1963C13.9292 15.597 13.864 15.9576 13.7197 16.2939L13.6533 16.4365C13.3878 16.9576 12.9841 17.3941 12.4883 17.6982L12.2705 17.8203C11.8937 18.0123 11.4873 18.0915 11.0293 18.1289C10.5791 18.1657 10.022 18.165 9.33301 18.165H6.5C5.81091 18.165 5.25395 18.1657 4.80371 18.1289C4.40306 18.0962 4.04235 18.031 3.70606 17.8867L3.56348 17.8203C3.04244 17.5548 2.60585 17.151 2.30176 16.6553L2.17969 16.4365C1.98788 16.0599 1.90851 15.6541 1.87109 15.1963C1.83431 14.746 1.83496 14.1891 1.83496 13.5V10.667C1.83496 9.978 1.83432 9.42091 1.87109 8.9707C1.90851 8.5127 1.98772 8.10625 2.17969 7.72949L2.30176 7.51172C2.60586 7.0159 3.04236 6.6122 3.56348 6.34668L3.70606 6.28027C4.04237 6.136 4.40303 6.07083 4.80371 6.03809C5.14051 6.01057 5.53708 6.00551 6.00391 6.00391C6.00551 5.53708 6.01057 5.14051 6.03809 4.80371C6.0755 4.34588 6.15483 3.94012 6.34668 3.56348L6.46875 3.34473C6.77282 2.84912 7.20856 2.44514 7.72949 2.17969L7.87207 2.11328C8.20855 1.96886 8.56979 1.90385 8.9707 1.87109C9.42091 1.83432 9.978 1.83496 10.667 1.83496H13.5C14.1891 1.83496 14.746 1.83431 15.1963 1.87109C15.6541 1.90851 16.0599 1.98788 16.4365 2.17969L16.6553 2.30176C17.151 2.60585 17.5548 3.04244 17.8203 3.56348L17.8867 3.70606C18.031 4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre!"><span><span>Exception ignored </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span>: &lt;</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span></span><span> Chrome.__del__ at </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>x...&gt;
...
</span><span><span class="hljs-symbol">OSError:</span></span><span> [WinError </span><span><span class="hljs-number">6</span></span><span>] The handle </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">is</span></span><span> invalid
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="136" data-end="477">means the problem happens when Python's garbage collector tries to call <code data-start="208" data-end="223">driver.quit()</code> automatically on the <code data-start="245" data-end="270">undetected_chromedriver</code> Chrome object <strong data-start="285" data-end="299">destructor</strong> (the <code data-start="305" data-end="314">__del__</code> method). This usually occurs when the program is closing or the driver object is being deleted, but the underlying ChromeDriver process handle is no longer valid.</p>
<hr data-start="479" data-end="482">
<h3 data-start="484" data-end="505">Why this happens:</h3>
<ul data-start="507" data-end="766">
<li data-start="507" data-end="630">
<p data-start="509" data-end="630">It’s a known issue on Windows with some versions of <code data-start="561" data-end="586">undetected-chromedriver</code> and how Python finalizes the driver object.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="631" data-end="727">
<p data-start="633" data-end="727">The driver process might already be closed or the handle lost by the time <code data-start="707" data-end="716">__del__</code> is called.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="728" data-end="766">
<p data-start="730" data-end="766">It’s usually <strong data-start="743" data-end="765">harmless but noisy</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="768" data-end="771">
<h3 data-start="773" data-end="799">How to fix / suppress:</h3>
<ol data-start="801" data-end="902">
<li data-start="801" data-end="902">
<p data-start="804" data-end="902"><strong data-start="804" data-end="860">Explicitly call <code data-start="822" data-end="837">driver.quit()</code> once when you finish</strong>, and <strong data-start="866" data-end="901">avoid relying on the destructor</strong>:</p>
</li>
</ol>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="904" data-end="1068"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center     driver.get(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://www.google.com"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># your code ...</span></span><span>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<ol start="2" data-start="1070" data-end="1227">
<li data-start="1070" data-end="1166">
<p data-start="1073" data-end="1166"><strong data-start="1073" data-end="1137">Suppress these warnings by catching in your code or patching</strong> — but usually not necessary.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1168" data-end="1227">
<p data-start="1171" data-end="1227"><strong data-start="1171" data-end="1208">Upgrade <code data-start="1181" data-end="1206">undetected-chromedriver</code></strong> to latest version:</p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="4" data-start="1288" data-end="1346">
<li data-start="1288" data-end="1346">
<p data-start="1291" data-end="1346"><strong data-start="1291" data-end="1346">Use <code data-start="1297" data-end="1305">atexit</code> to ensure cleanup before program ends:</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> atexit

driver = uc.Chrome()

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1520" data-end="1523">
<h3 data-start="1525" data-end="1536">Summary</h3>
<ul data-start="1538" data-end="1789">
<li data-start="1538" data-end="1608">
<p data-start="1540" data-end="1608">This error is usually safe to ignore if your script otherwise works.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1609" data-end="1685">
<p data-start="1611" data-end="1685">Just make sure you <strong data-start="1630" data-end="1665">call <code data-start="1637" data-end="1652">driver.quit()</code> explicitly</strong> to clean up Chrome.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1686" data-end="1719">
<p data-start="1688" data-end="1719">Update your packages regularly.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1720" data-end="1789">
<p data-start="1722" data-end="1789">Avoid leaving the driver object to be garbage collected implicitly.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1791" data-end="1794">
<p data-start="1796" data-end="1945" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">If your program works fine otherwise, you can proceed.<br data-start="1850" data-end="1853">

from selenium.common.exceptions import NoSuchElementException
import traceback
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.chrome.options import Options
import time
import datetime
import re

# === SETTINGS ===
LOGIN_URL = "https://sport.shahroodut.ac.ir/SportLogin"
RESERVATION_URL = "https://sport.shahroodut.ac.ir/SPReserve"
USERNAME = input("your_username")
PASSWORD = input("your_password")

# === SETUP SELENIUM ===
options = Options()
# options.add_argument("--headless")  # Uncomment if you want no window
driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=options)

def login():
    try:
        driver.get(LOGIN_URL)
        time.sleep(2)

        print("🔐 Filling credentials...")
        driver.find_element(By.ID, "txtusv").send_keys(USERNAME)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, "passv").send_keys(PASSWORD)

        print("🧠 Solving CAPTCHA...")
        captcha_text = driver.find_element(By.ID, "lbcode").text
        match = re.findall(r'\d+|\+|\-', captcha_text)
        if len(match) == 3:
            num1 = int(match[0])
            operator = match[1]
            num2 = int(match[2])
            result = num1 + num2 if operator == '+' else num1 - num2
            driver.find_element(By.ID, "txtcode").send_keys(str(result))
        else:
            print("❌ CAPTCHA parse failed.")
            return

        print("🚀 Submitting form...")
        driver.find_element(By.ID, "btlogin").click()
        time.sleep(3)

        print("✅ Login attempt complete.")

    except NoSuchElementException as e:
        print("❌ Element not found:", e)
        traceback.print_exc()
    except Exception as e:
        print("💥 Unexpected error:", e)
        traceback.print_exc()
    finally:
        input("🔚 Press Enter to close browser...")
        driver.quit()

tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="2d2238eb-e664-474a-b364-a1274b3f28a9" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4-1-mini"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="194">Thanks for sharing the full code! The logic looks solid, but the <code data-start="65" data-end="77">WinError 6</code> you see on exit is caused by how <code data-start="111" data-end="126">driver.quit()</code> interacts with the browser process on Windows in some environments.</p>
<h3 data-start="196" data-end="248">Here’s what you can do to fix or work around it:</h3>
<hr data-start="250" data-end="253">
<h2 data-start="255" data-end="365">1. Move <code data-start="266" data-end="281">driver.quit()</code> <strong data-start="282" data-end="293">outside</strong> the <code data-start="298" data-end="307">login()</code> function and call it once <strong data-start="334" data-end="343">after</strong> you finish all tasks.</h2>
<p data-start="367" data-end="535">Right now, you call <code data-start="387" data-end="402">driver.quit()</code> in the <code data-start="410" data-end="419">finally</code> block of <code data-start="429" data-end="438">login()</code>, which can sometimes cause this error if <code data-start="480" data-end="488">driver</code> is still being used or if it’s already closed.</p>
<hr data-start="537" data-end="540">
<h2 data-start="542" data-end="629">2. Avoid calling <code data-start="562" data-end="571">input()</code> inside <code data-start="579" data-end="588">finally</code> — it may cause issues in some terminals.</h2>
<p data-start="631" data-end="678">Instead, control the flow outside the function.</p>
<hr data-start="680" data-end="683">
<h2 data-start="685" data-end="705">Example refactor:</h2>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="707" data-end="1911"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-bg-elevated-secondary text-token-text-secondary flex items-center gap-4 rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login</span></span><span>():
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">try</span></span><span>:
        driver.get(LOGIN_URL)
        time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>)

        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Filling credentials..."</span></span><span>)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"txtusv"</span></span><span>).send_keys(USERNAME)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"passv"</span></span><span>).send_keys(PASSWORD)

        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🧠 Solving CAPTCHA..."</span></span><span>)
        captcha_text = driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lbcode"</span></span><span>).text
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span> = re.findall(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">r'\d+|\+|\-'</span></span><span>, captcha_text)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">len</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>) == </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>:
            num1 = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>])
            operator = </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
            num2 = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>])
            result = num1 + num2 </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> operator == </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'+'</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> num1 - num2
            driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"txtcode"</span></span><span>).send_keys(</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(result))
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
            </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ CAPTCHA parse failed."</span></span><span>)
            </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>

        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🚀 Submitting form..."</span></span><span>)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"btlogin"</span></span><span>).click()
        time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)

        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Login attempt complete."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">except</span></span><span> NoSuchElementException </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> e:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Element not found:"</span></span><span>, e)
        traceback.print_exc()
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">except</span></span><span> Exception </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> e:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"💥 Unexpected error:"</span></span><span>, e)
        traceback.print_exc()
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1913" data-end="1916">
<h2 data-start="1918" data-end="1951">Then in your main script flow:</h2>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1953" data-end="2304"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center 4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> __name__ == </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"__main__"</span></span><span>:
    success = login()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> success:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Logged in successfully."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># You can add reservation logic here...</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Login failed."</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">input</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔚 Press Enter to close browser..."</span></span><span>)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Wait for user to see result</span></span><span>

    driver.quit()  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Quit AFTER everything is done, only once</span></span><span>
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="2306" data-end="2309">
<h2 data-start="2311" data-end="2333">Why does this help?</h2>
<ul data-start="2335" data-end="2564">
<li data-start="2335" data-end="2388">
<p data-start="2337" data-end="2388"><code data-start="2337" data-end="2352">driver.quit()</code> runs once when you are really done.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2389" data-end="2483">
<p data-start="2391" data-end="2483">You avoid <code data-start="2401" data-end="2416">driver.quit()</code> being called while the <code data-start="2440" data-end="2448">driver</code> is still in use or multiple times.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2484" data-end="2564">
<p data-start="2486" data-end="2564"><code data-start="2486" data-end="2495">input()</code> is outside the <code data-start="2511" data-end="2524">try/finally</code>, avoiding weird terminal handle issues.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2566" data-end="2569">
<h2 data-start="2571" data-end="2584">Extra tip:</h2>
<p data-start="2586" data-end="2804">If you still get the <code data-start="2607" data-end="2619">WinError 6</code> exception <strong data-start="2630" data-end="2657">at interpreter shutdown</strong>, it’s generally safe to ignore as it won’t crash your program — it’s a Windows-specific cleanup warning when Python destroys the webdriver object.</p>
<hr data-start="2806" data-end="2809">
<p data-start="2811" data-end="2878" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Let me know if you want me to help write the reservation part next!</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none touch:w-[calc(100%+--spacing(3.5))] -mt-1 <h3 data-start="53" data-end="85">Next step: <strong data-start="68" data-end="85">Balance Check</strong></h3>
<p data-start="87" data-end="107">We want your bot to:</p>
<ul data-start="109" data-end="247">
<li data-start="109" data-end="176">
<p data-start="111" data-end="176">Check if your balance (credit/money/tickets) is enough to reserve</p>
</li>
<li data-start="177" data-end="222">
<p data-start="179" data-end="222">Only try reserving if balance is sufficient</p>
</li>
<li data-start="223" data-end="247">
<p data-start="225" data-end="247">Skip or wait otherwise</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="249" data-end="252">

<ol start="2" data-start="385" data-end="432">
<li data-start="385" data-end="432">
<p data-start="388" data-end="432"><strong data-start="388" data-end="432">Locate the balance element on that page:</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>
<ul data-start="434" data-end="654">
<li data-start="434" data-end="520">
<p data-start="436" data-end="520">Inspect the balance element on the website (like a <code data-start="487" data-end="495">&lt;span&gt;</code>, <code data-start="497" data-end="504">&lt;div&gt;</code>, or table cell)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="521" data-end="562">
<p data-start="523" data-end="562">Find its unique <code data-start="539" data-end="543">id</code>, <code data-start="545" data-end="552">class</code>, or XPath</p>
</li>

<hr data-start="1107" data-end="1110">
<h3 data-start="1112" data-end="1137">What I need from you:</h3>
<ul data-start="1139" data-end="1310">
<li data-start="1139" data-end="1232">
<p data-start="1141" data-end="1232">The <strong data-start="1145" data-end="1177">HTML snippet or element info</strong> of where and how balance shows on the reservation page</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1233" data-end="1310">
<p data-start="1235" data-end="1310">The <strong data-start="1239" data-end="1259">threshold amount</strong> you want to check for (e.g. 1 ticket = 10 credits)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1312" data-end="1315">
<h3 data-start="1317" data-end="1372">Then I’ll help you write the exact code snippet to:</h3>
<ul data-start="1374" data-end="1450">
<li data-start="1374" data-end="1407">
<p data-start="1376" data-end="1407">Grab your balance automatically</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1408" data-end="1428">
<p data-start="1410" data-end="1428">Make a clean check</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1429" data-end="1450">
<p data-start="1431" data-end="1450">Proceed accordingly</p>
</li>
</ul>

</div></div></div></div></div><div class="flex justify-end"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none focus-within:transition-none If <code data-start="42" data-end="57">driver.quit()</code> runs too early, it <strong data-start="77" data-end="127">kills the browser before your reservation step</strong> can even begin.</p>

<h3 data-start="150" data-end="189">🔧 Let’s set it up clean &amp; modular:</h3>
<p data-start="191" data-end="264">We’ll split it into <strong data-start="211" data-end="235">three main functions</strong>, then call them in sequence:</p>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login</span></span><span>():
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># ... your working login code ...</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> login_success </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">check_balance_and_reserve</span></span><span>():
    driver.get(RESERVATION_URL)
    time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>)
    
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># 1. Find and extract balance</span></span><span>
    balance_text = driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"your_balance_element_id"</span></span><span>).text
    balance_value = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">float</span></span><span>(re.findall(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">r"[\d.]+"</span></span><span>, balance_text)[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>])
    
    </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"💰 Your balance: <span class="hljs-subst">{balance_value}</span></span></span><span>")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># 2. Check if it's enough</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> balance_value &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">10</span></span><span>:  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># or whatever threshold</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Balance sufficient, attempting reservation..."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Call reserve_ticket() or similar here</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Not enough balance."</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">main</span></span><span>():
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> login():
        check_balance_and_reserve()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Login failed."</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">input</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔚 Press Enter to close browser..."</span></span><span>)
    driver.quit()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1145" data-end="1148">
<h3 data-start="1150" data-end="1172">🧠 Why This Works:</h3>
<ul data-start="1174" data-end="1385">
<li data-start="1174" data-end="1226">
<p data-start="1176" data-end="1226"><code data-start="1176" data-end="1191">driver.quit()</code> is called <strong data-start="1202" data-end="1226">only at the very end</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1227" data-end="1257">
<p data-start="1229" data-end="1257"><code data-start="1229" data-end="1238">login()</code> handles only login</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1258" data-end="1340">
<p data-start="1260" data-end="1340"><code data-start="1260" data-end="1289">check_balance_and_reserve()</code> is ready to grow into your full reservation system</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1341" data-end="1385">
<p data-start="1343" data-end="1385">Keeps your script easy to expand and debug</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1387" data-end="1390">
<h3 data-start="1392" data-end="1407">📌 Now You:</h3>
<ul data-start="1408" data-end="1555">
<li data-start="1408" data-end="1465">
<p data-start="1410" data-end="1465">Plug in the <strong data-start="1422" data-end="1465">real ID or class of the balance element</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1466" data-end="1555">
<p data-start="1468" data-end="1555">Let me know what the balance looks like if you're unsure — I’ll help extract it cleanly</p>
</li>
</ul>

driver.quit()  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Only here, after all tasks</span></span><span>
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="315" data-end="320">✅ So:</p>
<ul data-start="321" data-end="399">
<li data-start="321" data-end="357">
<p data-start="323" data-end="357"><code data-start="323" data-end="336">return True</code> → means login worked</p>
</li>
<li data-start="358" data-end="399">
<p data-start="360" data-end="399"><code data-start="360" data-end="375">driver.quit()</code> → stays at the end only</p>
</li>
</ul>

def login():
    try:
        driver.get(LOGIN_URL)
        time.sleep(2)

        print("🔐 Filling credentials...")
        driver.find_element(By.ID, "txtusv").send_keys(USERNAME)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, "passv").send_keys(PASSWORD)

        print("🧠 Solving CAPTCHA...")
        captcha_text = driver.find_element(By.ID, "lbcode").text
        match = re.findall(r'\d+|\+|\-', captcha_text)
        if len(match) == 3:
            num1 = int(match[0])
            operator = match[1]
            num2 = int(match[2])
            result = num1 + num2 if operator == '+' else num1 - num2
            driver.find_element(By.ID, "txtcode").send_keys(str(result))
        else:
            print("❌ CAPTCHA parse failed.")
            return

        print("🚀 Submitting form...")
        driver.find_element(By.ID, "btlogin").click()
        time.sleep(3)

        print("✅ Login attempt complete.")
        return True

    except NoSuchElementException as e:
        print("❌ Element not found:", e)
        traceback.print_exc()
        return False
    except Exception as e:
        print("💥 Unexpected error:", e)
        traceback.print_exc()
        return False
    finally:
        input("🔚 Press Enter to close browser...")
        

if __name__ == "__main__":
    success = login()
    if success:
        print("Logged in successfully.")
        # You can add reservation logic here...
    else:
        print("Login failed.")

    input("🔚 Press Enter to close browser...")  # Wait for user to see result

    driver.quit()  # Quit AFTER everything is done, only once</div></div></div></div></div><div class="flex justify-end"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center <p data-start="201" data-end="297">That line pauses <strong data-start="218" data-end="234">during login</strong>, and it's stopping your script <strong data-start="266" data-end="296">from moving to reservation</strong>.</p>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login</span></span><span>():
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">try</span></span><span>:
        driver.get(LOGIN_URL)
        time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>)

        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Filling credentials..."</span></span><span>)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"txtusv"</span></span><span>).send_keys(USERNAME)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"passv"</span></span><span>).send_keys(PASSWORD)

        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🧠 Solving CAPTCHA..."</span></span><span>)
        captcha_text = driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lbcode"</span></span><span>).text
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span> = re.findall(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">r'\d+|\+|\-'</span></span><span>, captcha_text)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">len</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>) == </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>:
            num1 = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>])
            operator = </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
            num2 = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>])
            result = num1 + num2 </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> operator == </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'+'</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> num1 - num2
            driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"txtcode"</span></span><span>).send_keys(</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(result))
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
            </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ CAPTCHA parse failed."</span></span><span>)
            </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>

        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🚀 Submitting form..."</span></span><span>)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"btlogin"</span></span><span>).click()
        time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)

        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Login attempt complete."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">except</span></span><span> NoSuchElementException </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> e:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Element not found:"</span></span><span>, e)
        traceback.print_exc()
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">except</span></span><span> Exception </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> e:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"💥 Unexpected error:"</span></span><span>, e)
        traceback.print_exc()
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># 🧼 finally block is not needed here at all — REMOVE IT</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># === Main ===</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> __name__ == </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"__main__"</span></span><span>:
    success = login()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> success:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Logged in successfully."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># ⏬ Call your reservation/check_balance here</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Login failed."</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">input</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔚 Press Enter to close browser..."</span></span><span>)
    driver.quit()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1893" data-end="1896">
<p data-start="1898" data-end="1917">Now your code will:</p>
<ul data-start="1918" data-end="1992">
<li data-start="1918" data-end="1927">
<p data-start="1920" data-end="1927">Login ✅</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1928" data-end="1951">
<p data-start="1930" data-end="1951">Go to next function ✅</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1952" data-end="1992">
<p data-start="1954" data-end="1992">Wait at the very end before quitting ✅</p>
</li>
</ul>

4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">check_balance_and_reserve</span></span><span>():
    driver.get(RESERVATION_URL)
    time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">try</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Example — REPLACE with your real element ID or XPath</span></span><span>
        balance_text = driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lblCredit"</span></span><span>).text  
        balance_value = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(re.findall(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">r'\d+'</span></span><span>, balance_text)[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>])
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"💰 Your balance: <span class="hljs-subst">{balance_value}</span></span></span><span>")

        </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Set your required minimum balance</span></span><span>
        required_balance = </span><span><span class="hljs-number">10000</span></span><span>  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># example threshold</span></span><span>

        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> balance_value &gt;= required_balance:
            </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Balance is enough! Proceeding to reserve..."</span></span><span>)
            </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># reserve_ticket()  ← we’ll write this next</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
            </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Not enough balance to reserve."</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">except</span></span><span> Exception </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> e:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"⚠️ Couldn’t read balance or page failed."</span></span><span>)
        traceback.print_exc()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

<h3 data-start="70" data-end="94">⚡ Short Explanation:</h3>
<ul data-start="96" data-end="254">
<li data-start="96" data-end="155">
<p data-start="98" data-end="155"><code data-start="98" data-end="106">r'\d+'</code> = regex pattern meaning <strong data-start="131" data-end="155">"one or more digits"</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="156" data-end="211">
<p data-start="158" data-end="211"><code data-start="158" data-end="175">re.findall(...)</code> = finds <strong data-start="184" data-end="199">all numbers</strong> in the text</p>
</li>
<li data-start="212" data-end="254">
<p data-start="214" data-end="254"><code data-start="214" data-end="219">[0]</code> = takes the <strong data-start="232" data-end="254">first number found</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="256" data-end="259">

<p data-start="383" data-end="428">Then <code data-start="388" data-end="393">[0]</code> → <code data-start="396" data-end="405">'14500'</code> → you convert to <code data-start="423" data-end="428">int</code></p>
<p data-start="430" data-end="489" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">💡 This helps when balance text has both words and numbers.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] <p data-start="170" data-end="268">So we need to handle the <strong data-start="195" data-end="204">comma</strong>, otherwise Python will throw an error when converting to <code data-start="262" data-end="267">int</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="270" data-end="273">
<h3 data-start="275" data-end="298">✅ Clean &amp; Safe Fix:</h3>
<p data-start="300" data-end="336">Replace the original line with this:</p>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="463" data-end="538">📌 <code data-start="466" data-end="484">replace(",", "")</code> removes the comma → so <code data-start="508" data-end="519">'150,000'</code> becomes <code data-start="528" data-end="538">'150000'</code></p>
<hr data-start="540" data-end="543">
<h3 data-start="545" data-end="591">🔒 Optional: Regex Alternative (works too)</h3>

rial_balance = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(balance_text.replace(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">","</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">""</span></span><span>))        </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Remove comma and convert to int</span></span><span>
toman_balance = rial_balance // </span><span><span class="hljs-number">10</span></span><span>                       </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Drop one zero → Toman</span></span><span>
formatted_balance = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{:,}"</span></span><span>.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">format</span></span><span>(toman_balance)         </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Add comma formatting</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"💰 Your balance: <span class="hljs-subst">{formatted_balance}</span></span></span><span> تومان")
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="520" data-end="523">
<h3 data-start="525" data-end="540">🧠 Example:</h3>
<p data-start="542" data-end="575">If <code data-start="545" data-end="559">balance_text</code> is <code data-start="563" data-end="574">"150,000"</code>:</p>
<ul data-start="576" data-end="660">
<li data-start="576" data-end="601">
<p data-start="578" data-end="601"><code data-start="578" data-end="601">rial_balance = 150000</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="602" data-end="627">
<p data-start="604" data-end="627"><code data-start="604" data-end="627">toman_balance = 15000</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="628" data-end="660">
<p data-start="630" data-end="660"><code data-start="630" data-end="660">formatted_balance = '15,000'</code></p>
</li>
</ul>

<p data-start="262" data-end="267">✅ It:</p>
<ul data-start="268" data-end="344">
<li data-start="268" data-end="284">
<p data-start="270" data-end="284">Removes commas</p>
</li>
<li data-start="285" data-end="317">
<p data-start="287" data-end="317">Extracts only the first number</p>
</li>
<li data-start="318" data-end="344">
<p data-start="320" data-end="344">Converts to <strong data-start="332" data-end="344">int Rial</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>

<p data-start="796" data-end="892" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">All set to roll.<br data-start="812" data-end="815">
Now ready to plug in the <strong data-start="840" data-end="863">reservation clicker</strong> when balance is high enough?</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div <h3 data-start="48" data-end="66">What you said:</h3>
<ul data-start="67" data-end="278">
<li data-start="67" data-end="149">
<p data-start="69" data-end="149">You have a <strong data-start="80" data-end="106">list (dropdown/select)</strong> for context, e.g., bodybuilding, gym, etc.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="150" data-end="207">
<p data-start="152" data-end="207">This list has <strong data-start="166" data-end="184">values 1 to 20</strong>, and <code data-start="190" data-end="194">-1</code> means "All".</p>
</li>
<li data-start="208" data-end="278">
<p data-start="210" data-end="278">You want to <strong data-start="222" data-end="244">select one context</strong> (like bodybuilding) by its value.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="280" data-end="283">
<h3 data-start="285" data-end="320">How to handle this in Selenium:</h3>
<ol data-start="322" data-end="456">
<li data-start="322" data-end="390">
<p data-start="325" data-end="390"><strong data-start="325" data-end="365">Find the dropdown <code data-start="345" data-end="355">&lt;select&gt;</code> element</strong> by ID or other selector.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="392" data-end="456">
<p data-start="395" data-end="456">Use Selenium’s <strong data-start="410" data-end="428"><code data-start="412" data-end="420">Select</code> class</strong> to pick the value you want.</p>
</li>
</ol>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> selenium.webdriver.support.ui </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Select

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Locate the select element by its ID</span></span><span>
select_element = driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"context_dropdown_id"</span></span><span>)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Replace with real ID</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Wrap it with Select</span></span><span>
select = Select(select_element)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Select by value (e.g., bodybuilding is value "3")</span></span><span>
select.select_by_value(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"3"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># OR select "All" by value "-1"</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># select.select_by_value("-1")</span></span><span>

time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Wait for page to load if it triggers update</span></span><span>
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="946" data-end="949">
<h3 data-start="951" data-end="971">What to do next:</h3>
<ul data-start="973" data-end="1220">
<li data-start="973" data-end="1044">
<p data-start="975" data-end="1044">Replace <code data-start="983" data-end="1006">"context_dropdown_id"</code> with your actual select element’s ID.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1045" data-end="1101">
<p data-start="1047" data-end="1101">Replace <code data-start="1055" data-end="1060">"3"</code> with the value for the context you want.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1102" data-end="1220">
<p data-start="1104" data-end="1220">If the page dynamically loads content after selection, add a small wait or check for content load before proceeding.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1222" data-end="1225">
<h3 data-start="1227" data-end="1238">Summary</h3>
<ul data-start="1240" data-end="1426">
<li data-start="1240" data-end="1292">
<p data-start="1242" data-end="1292">Use Selenium’s <code data-start="1257" data-end="1265">Select</code> class to handle dropdowns.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1293" data-end="1358">
<p data-start="1295" data-end="1358">Use <code data-start="1299" data-end="1334">.select_by_value("desired_value")</code> for your number values.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1359" data-end="1426">
<p data-start="1361" data-end="1426">Then proceed to scrape or interact with the updated page content.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1428" data-end="1431">

<hr data-start="173" data-end="176">
<h3 data-start="178" data-end="233">🔥 Now, Let’s Talk Next-Level: Easy + Mobile Access</h3>
<p data-start="235" data-end="315">Here are your top options to turn your bot into a <strong data-start="285" data-end="314">mobile-usable app or tool</strong>:</p>
<hr data-start="317" data-end="320">
<h2 data-start="322" data-end="369">✅ 1. <strong data-start="330" data-end="369">Telegram Bot (🔥 Easiest &amp; Coolest)</strong></h2>
<p data-start="371" data-end="434"><strong data-start="371" data-end="379">Why?</strong><br data-start="379" data-end="382">
Control your bot from your phone with messages like:</p>
<ul data-start="435" data-end="531">
<li data-start="435" data-end="455">
<p data-start="437" data-end="455"><code data-start="437" data-end="445">/start</code> → Logs in</p>
</li>
<li data-start="456" data-end="484">
<p data-start="458" data-end="484"><code data-start="458" data-end="468">/balance</code> → Shows balance</p>
</li>
<li data-start="485" data-end="531">
<p data-start="487" data-end="531"><code data-start="487" data-end="499">/reserve 3</code> → Tries to reserve context ID 3</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="533" data-end="545"><strong data-start="533" data-end="543">Tools:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="546" data-end="612">
<li data-start="546" data-end="575">
<p data-start="548" data-end="575">Use <code data-start="552" data-end="573">python-telegram-bot</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="576" data-end="612">
<p data-start="578" data-end="612">Fully works with your current code</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="614" data-end="684"><strong data-start="614" data-end="629">Cool bonus:</strong><br data-start="629" data-end="632">
Send a notification when reservation is successful ✅</p>
<hr data-start="686" data-end="689">
<h2 data-start="691" data-end="733">✅ 2. <strong data-start="699" data-end="733">Streamlit Web App (Simple GUI)</strong></h2>
<p data-start="735" data-end="811"><strong data-start="735" data-end="743">Why?</strong><br data-start="743" data-end="746">
Turns your Python bot into a <strong data-start="775" data-end="786">web app</strong> with buttons and fields.</p>
<p data-start="813" data-end="825"><strong data-start="813" data-end="825">You can:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="826" data-end="958">
<li data-start="826" data-end="851">
<p data-start="828" data-end="851">Enter username/password</p>
</li>
<li data-start="852" data-end="867">
<p data-start="854" data-end="867">Click “Login”</p>
</li>
<li data-start="868" data-end="887">
<p data-start="870" data-end="887">See balance in UI</p>
</li>
<li data-start="888" data-end="912">
<p data-start="890" data-end="912">Click “Reserve” button</p>
</li>
<li data-start="913" data-end="958">
<p data-start="915" data-end="958">Run it on PC or even host for LAN/Wi-Fi use</p>
</li>
</ul>

<hr data-start="1039" data-end="1042">
<h2 data-start="1044" data-end="1088">✅ 3. <strong data-start="1052" data-end="1088">Convert to APK (Real Mobile App)</strong></h2>
<blockquote data-start="1090" data-end="1108">
<p data-start="1092" data-end="1108">⚠️ More advanced</p>
</blockquote>
<p data-start="1110" data-end="1118">Options:</p>
<ul data-start="1119" data-end="1256">
<li data-start="1119" data-end="1159">
<p data-start="1121" data-end="1159">Use <strong data-start="1125" data-end="1133">Kivy</strong> (Python mobile framework)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1160" data-end="1256">
<p data-start="1162" data-end="1256">Or rewrite UI part in <strong data-start="1184" data-end="1195">Flutter</strong>/<strong data-start="1196" data-end="1212">React Native</strong> and communicate with Python backend via API</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1258" data-end="1336">Not recommended <em data-start="1274" data-end="1279">yet</em>, but if you’re down for a side quest later, I got you 🔧</p>
<hr data-start="1338" data-end="1341">
<h3 data-start="1343" data-end="1378">💡 Best Pick for You Right Now:</h3>
<p data-start="1379" data-end="1500"><strong data-start="1379" data-end="1395">Telegram Bot</strong> — minimal setup, easy control from phone, cool AF<br data-start="1445" data-end="1448">
We can fully build it together once uni opens again.</p>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram.ext </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Application, CommandHandler, ContextTypes
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Update
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> asyncio

TOKEN = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"YOUR_BOT_TOKEN"</span></span><span>  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Replace with your actual token</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># === COMMAND HANDLERS ===</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">start</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"👋 Yo bro! I’m your gym sniper bot.\nUse /login to begin."</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Logging in..."</span></span><span>)

    success = </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> asyncio.to_thread(run_login)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> success:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Logged in successfully!"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Login failed!"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Replace this with your real login logic</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">run_login</span></span><span>():
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> your_bot_file </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> login  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Import your real login function</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> login()

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># === MAIN SETUP ===</span></span><span>

app = Application.builder().token(TOKEN).build()
app.add_handler(CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>, start))
app.add_handler(CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"login"</span></span><span>, login))

</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🤖 Bot is running..."</span></span><span>)
app.run_polling()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1837" data-end="1840">
<h2 data-start="1842" data-end="1862">✅ What This Does:</h2>
<ul data-start="1864" data-end="1985">
<li data-start="1864" data-end="1885">
<p data-start="1866" data-end="1885">Runs a Telegram bot</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1886" data-end="1921">
<p data-start="1888" data-end="1921">Listens for <code data-start="1900" data-end="1908">/start</code> and <code data-start="1913" data-end="1921">/login</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1922" data-end="1985">
<p data-start="1924" data-end="1985">Calls your real <code data-start="1940" data-end="1949">login()</code> function <strong data-start="1959" data-end="1985">in a background thread</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>

<h3 data-start="553" data-end="564">⚠️ Tip:</h3>
<p data-start="565" data-end="667">Telegram usernames <strong data-start="584" data-end="602">must be unique</strong>, <strong data-start="604" data-end="635">must end in a letter/number</strong>, and <strong data-start="641" data-end="666">cannot contain spaces</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="669" data-end="802">Try a few combos from above and you’ll find the sweet one 🧩<br data-start="729" data-end="732">
Tell me what you pick — I’ll burn it into the code like a signature 🔥</p>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram.ext </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Application, CommandHandler, ContextTypes
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Update

TOKEN = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"YOUR_BOT_TOKEN"</span></span><span>  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># from BotFather</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">start</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"👋 reSUT_minibot at your service!\nUse /login to begin."</span></span><span>)

app = Application.builder().token(TOKEN).build()
app.add_handler(CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>, start))

</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🤖 Bot is now running..."</span></span><span>)
app.run_polling()  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># 🔥 this is what starts listening to /start</span></span><span>
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="785" data-end="788">
<h3 data-start="790" data-end="817">✅ To activate your bot:</h3>
<ol data-start="819" data-end="1006">
<li data-start="819" data-end="868">
<p data-start="822" data-end="868">Save that code in a file (e.g. <code data-start="853" data-end="867">resut_bot.py</code>)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="869" data-end="937">
<p data-start="872" data-end="896">In your terminal or CMD:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="900" data-end="937"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center <p data-start="1013" data-end="1110">If you’ve only copied the token so far and didn’t run the polling app, the bot won’t respond yet.</p>

<p data-start="69" data-end="142">but the bot <strong data-start="81" data-end="110">doesn’t reply to <code data-start="100" data-end="108">/start</code></strong>, then 100% the issue is either:</p>
<hr data-start="144" data-end="147">
<h3 data-start="149" data-end="194">⚠️ 1. <strong data-start="159" data-end="194">Bot not started in Telegram yet</strong></h3>
<p data-start="195" data-end="266">Make sure you actually clicked <strong data-start="226" data-end="235">Start</strong> in your bot's chat, like this:</p>
<ol data-start="268" data-end="364">
<li data-start="268" data-end="298">
<p data-start="271" data-end="298">Open your bot in Telegram</p>
</li>
<li data-start="299" data-end="334">
<p data-start="302" data-end="334">Tap <strong data-start="306" data-end="315">Start</strong> or type <code data-start="324" data-end="332">/start</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="335" data-end="364">
<p data-start="338" data-end="364">Look for a message from it</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="366" data-end="411">🧠 <strong data-start="369" data-end="392">If it doesn’t reply</strong>, move to check #2.</p>
<hr data-start="413" data-end="416">
<h3 data-start="418" data-end="470">⚠️ 2. <strong data-start="428" data-end="470">Bot Privacy Mode is On (Blocks /start)</strong></h3>
<p data-start="472" data-end="536">If you added your bot to a group or using a private mode, go to:</p>
<ul data-start="538" data-end="691">
<li data-start="538" data-end="617">
<p data-start="540" data-end="617"><a data-start="540" data-end="576" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="cursor-pointer">@BotFather</a> → your bot → <code data-start="590" data-end="599">/mybots</code> → select your bot</p>
</li>
<li data-start="618" data-end="663">
<p data-start="620" data-end="663">Choose <strong data-start="627" data-end="643">Bot Settings</strong> → <strong data-start="646" data-end="663">Group Privacy</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="664" data-end="691">
<p data-start="666" data-end="691"><strong data-start="666" data-end="691">Turn OFF privacy mode</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="693" data-end="778">But if you're messaging the bot directly (not in group), this shouldn’t be the issue.</p>
<hr data-start="780" data-end="783">
<h3 data-start="785" data-end="844">⚠️ 3. <strong data-start="795" data-end="844">The <code data-start="801" data-end="817">CommandHandler</code> didn’t register properly</strong></h3>
<p data-start="846" data-end="893">Double-check this part is correct and in order:</p>

1.83496H13.5C14.1891 1.83496 14.746 1.83431 15.1963 1.87109C15.6541 1.90851 16.0599 1.98788 16.4365 2.17969L16.6553 2.30176C17.151 2.60585 17.5548 3.04244 17.8203 3.56348L17.8867 3.70606C18.031 4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram.ext </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Application, CommandHandler, ContextTypes
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Update

TOKEN = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"YOUR_TOKEN"</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">start</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"👋 Yo! reSUT_minibot reporting for duty."</span></span><span>)

app = Application.builder().token(TOKEN).build()
app.add_handler(CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>, start))

</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🤖 Bot is now running..."</span></span><span>)
app.run_polling()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1328" data-end="1338">Make sure:</p>
<ul data-start="1339" data-end="1467">
<li data-start="1339" data-end="1369">
<p data-start="1341" data-end="1369">No typos in <code data-start="1353" data-end="1369">CommandHandler</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1370" data-end="1400">
<p data-start="1372" data-end="1400">Your Python version is 3.10+</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1401" data-end="1467">
<p data-start="1403" data-end="1467">You installed the latest version of <code data-start="1439" data-end="1460">python-telegram-bot</code> (v20+)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1469" data-end="1480">You can do:</p>

from telegram.ext import Application, CommandHandler, ContextTypes
from telegram import Update

TOKEN = "7568694178:AAHMNPuAFCVP0DG2ONM1NsfWw4ZoWzOoBMc"  # from BotFather

async def start(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    print("📩 /start received!")
    await update.message.reply_text("👋 reSUT_minibot online.")

app = Application.builder().token(TOKEN).build()
app.add_handler(CommandHandler("start", start))

print("🤖 Bot is now running...")
app.run_polling()

<blockquote data-start="549" data-end="703">
<p data-start="551" data-end="703">❌ If <strong data-start="556" data-end="578">no message appears</strong>, that means the bot never got the update.<br>
✅ If message <strong data-start="636" data-end="651">does appear</strong>, but no Telegram reply → firewall or network issue.</p>
</blockquote>
<hr data-start="705" data-end="708">

<p data-start="827" data-end="953">→ Make sure you’re messaging <strong data-start="856" data-end="874">that exact bot</strong><br data-start="874" data-end="877">

<hr data-start="955" data-end="958">
<h4 data-start="960" data-end="1001">🔹 4. <strong data-start="971" data-end="1001">Bot Token Issue or Expired</strong></h4>
<p data-start="1003" data-end="1038">Try <strong data-start="1007" data-end="1023">regenerating</strong> a fresh token:</p>
<ul data-start="1040" data-end="1139">
<li data-start="1040" data-end="1060">
<p data-start="1042" data-end="1060">Go to <code data-start="1048" data-end="1060">@BotFather</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1061" data-end="1110">
<p data-start="1063" data-end="1110">Use <code data-start="1067" data-end="1075">/token</code> → Select your bot → Copy new token</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1111" data-end="1139">
<p data-start="1113" data-end="1139">Replace it in your script:</p>
</li>
</ul>

<p data-start="1179" data-end="1202">Then rerun your script.</p>
<hr data-start="1204" data-end="1207">
<h4 data-start="1209" data-end="1255">🔹 5. <strong data-start="1220" data-end="1255">Bot Blocked by You Accidentally</strong></h4>
<p data-start="1257" data-end="1302">If you ever blocked your bot, it won’t reply.</p>
<p data-start="1304" data-end="1408">Go to your bot chat → tap top bar → check if it says “Unblock”<br data-start="1366" data-end="1369">
If yes, unblock it and resend <code data-start="1399" data-end="1407">/start</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="1410" data-end="1413">
<h3 data-start="1415" data-end="1474">✅ If All Else Fails: Test from Another Telegram Account</h3>
<p data-start="1476" data-end="1544">Log in from another phone/account → open your bot → click <strong data-start="1534" data-end="1543">Start</strong>.</p>
<hr data-start="1546" data-end="1549">

<blockquote data-start="427" data-end="495">
<p data-start="429" data-end="495">That should allow <code data-start="447" data-end="463">.run_polling()</code> to connect to Telegram servers.</p>
</blockquote>
<hr data-start="497" data-end="500">
<h4 data-start="502" data-end="556">🔹 2. <strong data-start="513" data-end="556">Run the Bot from a Server (Recommended)</strong></h4>
<p data-start="557" data-end="591">Deploy your bot to a cloud server:</p>
<ul data-start="593" data-end="732">
<li data-start="593" data-end="641">
<p data-start="595" data-end="641">🆓 <strong data-start="598" data-end="612">Render.com</strong> (free for small Python bots)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="642" data-end="662">
<p data-start="644" data-end="662">🆓 <strong data-start="647" data-end="662">Railway.app</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="663" data-end="732">
<p data-start="665" data-end="732">🧠 Or a <strong data-start="673" data-end="686">cheap VPS</strong> outside Iran (Germany or Netherlands is fast)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="734" data-end="798">Once deployed, it will work 24/7 without needing your PC or VPN.</p>
<hr data-start="800" data-end="803">
<h4 data-start="805" data-end="870">🔹 3. <strong data-start="816" data-end="859">Use Telegram Webhook Instead of Polling</strong> (Advanced)</h4>
<p data-start="871" data-end="962">Instead of polling, you can <strong data-start="899" data-end="919">set up a webhook</strong> (Telegram sends data to your server), but:</p>
<ul data-start="964" data-end="1055">
<li data-start="964" data-end="1003">
<p data-start="966" data-end="1003">You need an <strong data-start="978" data-end="1003">HTTPS public endpoint</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1004" data-end="1055">
<p data-start="1006" data-end="1055">Usually needs <strong data-start="1020" data-end="1045">Flask/FastAPI + ngrok</strong> or server</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1057" data-end="1108">Not ideal for now unless you're into backend stuff.</p>
<hr data-start="1110" data-end="1113">
<h3 data-start="1115" data-end="1136">💡 Best Move Now:</h3>
<p data-start="1137" data-end="1330" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Just connect a VPN, re-run the bot, and <code data-start="1177" data-end="1185">/start</code> will snap into action like magic 🔥<br data-start="1221" data-end="1224">
Let me know when you're ready and I’ll drop the <code data-start="1272" data-end="1282">/balance</code> code next.<br data-start="1293" data-end="1296">

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram.ext </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Application, CommandHandler
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> socks
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> asyncio

TOKEN = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"your_token_here"</span></span><span>

proxy_url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"socks5://username:password@proxy_ip:port"</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">start</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update, context</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"👋 reSUT_minibot is online."</span></span><span>)

app.add_handler(CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>, start))
app.run_polling()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="921" data-end="936">🧠 You’ll need:</p>
<ul data-start="937" data-end="1027">
<li data-start="937" data-end="1027">
<p data-start="939" data-end="1027">A working <strong data-start="949" data-end="965">SOCKS5 proxy</strong><br>
(you can use Tor or grab a public proxy online for testing)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1029" data-end="1032">
<h2 data-start="1034" data-end="1104">✅ 2. <strong data-start="1042" data-end="1067">Host the Bot on a VPS</strong> (One-time setup, permanent solution)</h2>
<p data-start="1106" data-end="1178">Rent a cheap VPS (outside Iran, e.g., Hetzner or Contabo) for ~$4/month:</p>
<ul data-start="1180" data-end="1306">
<li data-start="1180" data-end="1195">
<p data-start="1182" data-end="1195"><code data-start="1182" data-end="1187">ssh</code> into it</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1196" data-end="1248">
<p data-start="1198" data-end="1248">install Python &amp; <code data-start="1215" data-end="1248">pip install python-telegram-bot</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1249" data-end="1306">
<p data-start="1251" data-end="1306">run your script — works 24/7, no filters, no VPN needed</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1308" data-end="1311">

<h3 data-start="1930" data-end="1957">What You Should Do Now:</h3>
<p data-start="1959" data-end="2133"><strong data-start="1959" data-end="1985">Try SOCKS5 proxy first</strong> (I can help you set it up).<br data-start="2013" data-end="2016">

@[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="36">⚠️ Almost bro — but here’s the deal:</p>
<hr data-start="38" data-end="41">
<h3 data-start="43" data-end="102">🔍 <strong data-start="50" data-end="100">MTProto Proxy (Like what Telegram clients use)</strong></h3>
<p data-start="103" data-end="227">MTProto is the encryption protocol used by <strong data-start="146" data-end="163">Telegram apps</strong>, and MTProto proxies are designed for <strong data-start="202" data-end="211">users</strong> — not <strong data-start="218" data-end="226">bots</strong>.</p>
<blockquote data-start="229" data-end="315">
<p data-start="231" data-end="315">❌ <strong data-start="233" data-end="259">Bots can't use MTProto</strong><br data-start="259" data-end="262">
Bots <strong data-start="267" data-end="283">only support</strong> these protocols for connection:</p>
</blockquote>
<ul data-start="316" data-end="368">
<li data-start="316" data-end="339">
<p data-start="318" data-end="339"><code data-start="318" data-end="325">https</code> (for webhook)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="340" data-end="350">
<p data-start="342" data-end="350"><code data-start="342" data-end="350">socks5</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="351" data-end="368">
<p data-start="353" data-end="368"><code data-start="353" data-end="362">http(s)</code> proxy</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="370" data-end="373">
<h3 data-start="375" data-end="398">✅ So the answer is:</h3>
<p data-start="399" data-end="440"><strong data-start="399" data-end="440">MTProto won’t work for Telegram bots.</strong></p>
<p data-start="442" data-end="531">But you're close! If you want a working setup without buying a VPS, your best bet now is:</p>
<hr data-start="533" data-end="536">

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram.ext </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Application, CommandHandler
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> asyncio

TOKEN = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"your_bot_token"</span></span><span>
proxy_url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"socks5://185.199.231.45:8380"</span></span><span>  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Example proxy</span></span><span>

app = Application.builder().token(TOKEN).proxy_url(proxy_url).get_updates_proxy_url(proxy_url).build()

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">start</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update, context</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"👋 reSUT_minibot is online."</span></span><span>)

app.add_handler(CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>, start))

</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Bot with proxy is running..."</span></span><span>)
app.run_polling()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1234" data-end="1237">
<h3 data-start="1239" data-end="1250">💡 Tip:</h3>
<p data-start="1251" data-end="1338">If that proxy doesn't work, I can help you find others or set one up for long-term use.</p>
<p data-start="1340" data-end="1464" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Want me to show you a trusted proxy list for testing?
