4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram.ext </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Application, CommandHandler, ContextTypes
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Update
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> selenium </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> webdriver
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> selenium.webdriver.common.by </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> By
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> selenium.webdriver.chrome.options </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> Options
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> re, time, traceback

TOKEN = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"YOUR_BOT_TOKEN"</span></span><span>  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Replace with your bot token</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># ===== LOGIN CONFIG =====</span></span><span>
LOGIN_URL = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://sport.shahroodut.ac.ir/SportLogin"</span></span><span>
USERNAME = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"your_username_here"</span></span><span>
PASSWORD = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"your_password_here"</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Global driver</span></span><span>
driver = </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">None</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># === Login Function ===</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login</span></span><span>():
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">global</span></span><span> driver
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">try</span></span><span>:
        chrome_options = Options()
        chrome_options.add_argument(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'--headless'</span></span><span>)
        chrome_options.add_argument(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'--no-sandbox'</span></span><span>)
        chrome_options.add_argument(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'--disable-dev-shm-usage'</span></span><span>)
        driver = webdriver.Chrome(options=chrome_options)

        driver.get(LOGIN_URL)
        time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>)

        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"txtusv"</span></span><span>).send_keys(USERNAME)
        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"passv"</span></span><span>).send_keys(PASSWORD)

        captcha_text = driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lbcode"</span></span><span>).text
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span> = re.findall(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">r'\d+|\+|\-'</span></span><span>, captcha_text)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">len</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>) == </span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>:
            num1 = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>])
            operator = </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
            num2 = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">int</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">match</span></span><span>[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>])
            result = num1 + num2 </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> operator == </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'+'</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span> num1 - num2
            driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"txtcode"</span></span><span>).send_keys(</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(result))
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
            </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ CAPTCHA parse failed."</span></span><span>)
            </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>

        driver.find_element(By.ID, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"btlogin"</span></span><span>).click()
        time.sleep(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">except</span></span><span> Exception </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> e:
        traceback.print_exc()
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># === Telegram Commands ===</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">start</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"👋 Welcome to reSUT_minibot.\nUse /login to start."</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login_command</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Trying to log in..."</span></span><span>)
    success = </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> context.application.run_in_threadpool(login)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> success:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Logged in successfully."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Login failed. Check credentials or site status."</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># === Bot Setup ===</span></span><span>

app = Application.builder().token(TOKEN).build()
app.add_handler(CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>, start))
app.add_handler(CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"login"</span></span><span>, login_command))

</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🤖 reSUT_minibot is running..."</span></span><span>)
app.run_polling()
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

<h3 data-start="2899" data-end="2922">📌 What to do next:</h3>

<ul data-start="2939" data-end="2997">
<li data-start="2939" data-end="2959">
<p data-start="2941" data-end="2959"><code data-start="2941" data-end="2959">"YOUR_BOT_TOKEN"</code></p>

</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="2998" data-end="3015">
<p data-start="3001" data-end="3015">Run the script</p>
</li>

</li>
</ol>

break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="87">BOOM 💥 Let’s upgrade this baby right 🔧<br data-start="40" data-end="43">
We’ll make <code data-start="54" data-end="69">reSUT_minibot</code> ask the user for:</p>
<ul data-start="89" data-end="127">
<li data-start="89" data-end="109">
<p data-start="91" data-end="109"><code data-start="91" data-end="101">Username</code> 🧑‍💻</p>
</li>
<li data-start="110" data-end="127">
<p data-start="112" data-end="127"><code data-start="112" data-end="122">Password</code> 🔐</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="129" data-end="198">And store them <strong data-start="144" data-end="159">temporarily</strong> per session using <code data-start="178" data-end="197">context.user_data</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="200" data-end="203">
<h3 data-start="205" data-end="233">✅ Here’s what we’ll add:</h3>
<ol data-start="235" data-end="380">
<li data-start="235" data-end="270">
<p data-start="238" data-end="270"><code data-start="238" data-end="244">/set</code> → bot asks for username</p>
</li>
<li data-start="271" data-end="306">
<p data-start="274" data-end="306">Waits for response → stores it</p>
</li>
<li data-start="307" data-end="334">
<p data-start="310" data-end="334">Then asks for password</p>
</li>
<li data-start="335" data-end="380">
<p data-start="338" data-end="380">After both are set → user can run <code data-start="372" data-end="380">/login</code></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="382" data-end="385">

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram.ext </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> MessageHandler, ConversationHandler, filters

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Conversation states</span></span><span>
SET_USERNAME, SET_PASSWORD = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">range</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">set_command</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🧑‍💻 Please enter your username:"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> SET_USERNAME

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_username</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    context.user_data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>] = update.message.text
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Now enter your password:"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> SET_PASSWORD

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_password</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    context.user_data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"password"</span></span><span>] = update.message.text
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Credentials saved. You can now use /login."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> ConversationHandler.END

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">cancel</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Canceled."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> ConversationHandler.END
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login_command</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Trying to log in..."</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">wrapped_login</span></span><span>():
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> login(context)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># pass context so it grabs username/password</span></span><span>

    success = </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> context.application.run_in_threadpool(wrapped_login)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> success:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Logged in successfully."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Login failed. Check credentials or site status."</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span>conv_handler = ConversationHandler(
    entry_points=[CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"set"</span></span><span>, set_command)],
    states={
        SET_USERNAME: [MessageHandler(filters.TEXT &amp; ~filters.COMMAND, get_username)],
        SET_PASSWORD: [MessageHandler(filters.TEXT &amp; ~filters.COMMAND, get_password)],
    },
    fallbacks=[CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"cancel"</span></span><span>, cancel)],
)

app.add_handler(conv_handler)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

<p data-start="160" data-end="256">But now we want to pass <code data-start="184" data-end="193">context</code> from the bot handler so it can access the <code data-start="236" data-end="255">context.user_data</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="258" data-end="261">
<h3 data-start="263" data-end="284">✅ Fix in 2 steps:</h3>
<hr data-start="286" data-end="289">

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">global</span></span><span> driver
    USERNAME = context.user_data.get(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>)

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="488" data-end="547">This way, it reads <code data-start="507" data-end="517">username</code> and <code data-start="522" data-end="532">password</code> set by <code data-start="540" data-end="546">/set</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="549" data-end="552">

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login_command</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Trying to log in..."</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">wrapped_login</span></span><span>():
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> login(context)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># 🔥 now context is passed into login()</span></span><span>

    success = </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> context.application.run_in_threadpool(wrapped_login)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> success:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Logged in successfully."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Login failed. Check credentials or site status."</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1120" data-end="1123">
<p data-start="1125" data-end="1246">That’s it! Now <code data-start="1140" data-end="1149">context</code> is <strong data-start="1153" data-end="1183">available inside <code data-start="1172" data-end="1181">login()</code></strong>, and the login will use the username/password set by the user.</p>

data-scroll-anchor="false"><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT said:</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="928257f5-ea06-4d98-a978-a1a83668ff20" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="129">🧠 <strong data-start="3" data-end="20">Short answer:</strong><br data-start="20" data-end="23">
Yes — the bot saves <strong data-start="43" data-end="73">username/password per user</strong> <strong data-start="74" data-end="102">during that session only</strong> using <code data-start="109" data-end="128">context.user_data</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="131" data-end="134">
<p data-start="136" data-end="240">⚠️ <strong data-start="139" data-end="146">But</strong>:<br data-start="147" data-end="150">
This data is stored <strong data-start="170" data-end="195">temporarily in memory</strong> — if the bot restarts or crashes, it's gone.</p>
<hr data-start="242" data-end="245">
<h3 data-start="247" data-end="281">✅ To save for future sessions:</h3>
<p data-start="282" data-end="372">You’d need to store them in a <strong data-start="312" data-end="334">database or a file</strong> (e.g., <code data-start="342" data-end="348">JSON</code>, SQLite) per <code data-start="362" data-end="371">user_id</code>.</p>
<p data-start="374" data-end="460" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Want me to add a secure <code data-start="398" data-end="404">JSON</code>-based storage so users don’t have to retype every time?</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none touch:w-[calc(100%+--spacing(3.5))] -mt-1 w-[calc(100%+--spacing(2.5))] duration-[1.5s] focus-within:transition-none hover:transition-none pointer-events-none [mask-image:linear-gradient(to_right,black_33%,transparent_66%)] [mask-size:300%_100%] [mask-position:100%_0%] motion-safe:transition-[mask-position] group-hover/turn-messages:pointer-events-auto group-hover/turn-messages:[mask-position:0_0] group-focus-within/turn-messages:pointer-events-auto group-focus-within/turn-messages:[mask-position:0_0] has-data-[state=open]:pointer-events-auto <hr data-start="353" data-end="356">
<h3 data-start="358" data-end="389">✅ Step-by-Step Code Upgrade</h3>
<h4 data-start="391" data-end="430">1️⃣ Add this JSON handler utility:</h4>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> json
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> os

USER_DATA_FILE = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"user_credentials.json"</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">load_user_data</span></span><span>():
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> os.path.exists(USER_DATA_FILE):
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">with</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">open</span></span><span>(USER_DATA_FILE, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"r"</span></span><span>) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> f:
            </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> json.load(f)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> {}

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">save_user_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">data</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">with</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">open</span></span><span>(USER_DATA_FILE, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"w"</span></span><span>) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> f:
        json.dump(data, f)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_password</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    user_id = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(update.effective_user.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">id</span></span><span>)
    password = update.message.text
    username = context.user_data.get(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>)

    data = load_user_data()
    data[user_id] = {</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>: username, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"password"</span></span><span>: password}
    save_user_data(data)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Credentials saved permanently. You can now use /login."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> ConversationHandler.END
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">global</span></span><span> driver
    data = load_user_data()
    creds = data.get(</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(user_id))

        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-literal">False</span></span><span>

    USERNAME = creds[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>]
    PASSWORD = creds[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"password"</span></span><span>]
    
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># [rest of your Selenium login logic...]</span></span><span>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login_command</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Trying to log in..."</span></span><span>)
    user_id = update.effective_user.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">id</span></span><span>

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">wrapped_login</span></span><span>():
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> login(user_id)

    success = </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> context.application.run_in_threadpool(wrapped_login)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> success:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Logged in successfully."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"❌ Login failed. Try /set again."</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

<h3 data-start="2179" data-end="2198">✅ Final Result:</h3>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login_info</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    user_id = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(update.effective_user.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">id</span></span><span>)
    data = load_user_data()

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> user_id </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        username = data[user_id][</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>]
        password_length = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">len</span></span><span>(data[user_id][</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"password"</span></span><span>])
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"🧾 &lt;b&gt;Saved Login Info:&lt;/b&gt;\n"</span></span><span>
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"👤 Username: &lt;code&gt;<span class="hljs-subst">{username}</span></span></span><span>&lt;/code&gt;\n"
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"🔐 Password: <span class="hljs-subst">{<span class="hljs-string">'•'</span></span></span></span><span> * password_length}\n"
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"(Stored securely on bot)"</span></span><span>,
            parse_mode=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"HTML"</span></span><span>
        )
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"⚠️ No login info found. Use /set to provide it."</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>

<h3 data-start="1222" data-end="1245">Now users can type:</h3>

async def get_username(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    await update.message.reply_text("🧑‍💻 Please enter your username:")
    return SET_USERNAME

async def get_password(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    context.user_data["username"] = update.message.text
    await update.message.reply_text("🔐 Now enter your password:")
    return SET_PASSWORD

async def set_profile(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    user_id = str(update.effective_user.id)
    password = update.message.text
    username = context.user_data.get("username")

    data = load_user_data()
    data[user_id] = {"username": username, "password": password}
    save_user_data(data)

    await update.message.reply_text("✅ Credentials saved permanently. You can now use /login.")
    return ConversationHandler.END</div></div></div></div></div><div class="flex justify-end"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none data-scroll-anchor="false"><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT said:</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="267bebd6-16c8-4fe3-9673-7344e32c0291" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="51">✅ <strong data-start="2" data-end="50">Yes bro, delete those — they’re now outdated</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="53" data-end="81">You’ve upgraded your bot to:</p>
<ul data-start="83" data-end="238">
<li data-start="83" data-end="123">
<p data-start="85" data-end="123">Store credentials directly into JSON</p>
</li>
<li data-start="124" data-end="196">
<p data-start="126" data-end="196">Use a <strong data-start="132" data-end="155">cleaner 2-step flow</strong> (<code data-start="157" data-end="193">/set → username → password → saved</code>)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="197" data-end="238">
<p data-start="199" data-end="238">Fetch credentials from file when needed</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="240" data-end="243">
<h3 data-start="245" data-end="265">🔥 What to keep:</h3>
<p data-start="266" data-end="308">Just make sure you’re using these instead:</p>
<ol data-start="310" data-end="552">
<li data-start="310" data-end="352">
<p data-start="313" data-end="352">✅ <code data-start="315" data-end="330">set_command()</code> → asks for username</p>
</li>
<li data-start="353" data-end="411">
<p data-start="356" data-end="411">✅ <code data-start="358" data-end="374">get_username()</code> → stores it in <code data-start="390" data-end="409">context.user_data</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="412" data-end="474">
<p data-start="415" data-end="474">✅ <code data-start="417" data-end="433">get_password()</code> → grabs username, saves both into JSON</p>
</li>
<li data-start="475" data-end="509">
<p data-start="478" data-end="509">✅ <code data-start="480" data-end="489">login()</code> → reads from JSON</p>
</li>
<li data-start="510" data-end="552">
<p data-start="513" data-end="552">✅ <code data-start="515" data-end="528">/login_info</code> → shows stored username</p>
</li>
</ol>

You want <code data-start="31" data-end="44">/login_info</code> to <strong data-start="48" data-end="74">show saved credentials</strong> <em data-start="75" data-end="79">or</em> <strong data-start="80" data-end="107">ask for them if missing</strong> — that’s smooth UX.</p>
<hr data-start="129" data-end="132">
<h3 data-start="134" data-end="183">✅ Here’s the upgraded <code data-start="160" data-end="173">/login_info</code> function:</h3>
<p data-start="185" data-end="195">This will:</p>
<ul data-start="196" data-end="307">
<li data-start="196" data-end="237">
<p data-start="198" data-end="237">Show username/password if already saved</p>
</li>
<li data-start="238" data-end="307">
<p data-start="240" data-end="307">Else, walk the user through input flow (username → password → save)</p>
</li>
</ul>

3.56348 6.34668L3.70606 6.28027C4.04237 6.136 4.40303 6.07083 4.80371 6.03809C5.14051 6.01057 5.53708 6.00551 6.00391 6.00391C6.00551 5.53708 6.01057 5.14051 6.03809 4.80371C6.0755 4.34588 6.15483 3.94012 6.34668 3.56348L6.46875 3.34473C6.77282 2.84912 7.20856 2.44514 7.72949 2.17969L7.87207 2.11328C8.20855 1.96886 8.56979 1.90385 8.9707 1.87109C9.42091 1.83432 9.978 1.83496 10.667 1.83496H13.5C14.1891 1.83496 14.746 1.83431 15.1963 1.87109C15.6541 1.90851 16.0599 1.98788 16.4365 2.17969L16.6553 2.30176C17.151 2.60585 17.5548 3.04244 17.8203 3.56348L17.8867 3.70606C18.031 4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> telegram.ext </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> ConversationHandler, MessageHandler, filters

SET_USERNAME, SET_PASSWORD = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">range</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login_info</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    user_id = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(update.effective_user.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">id</span></span><span>)
    data = load_user_data()

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> user_id </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        username = data[user_id][</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>]
        password_length = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">len</span></span><span>(data[user_id][</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"password"</span></span><span>])
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"🧾 &lt;b&gt;Saved Login Info:&lt;/b&gt;\n"</span></span><span>
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"👤 Username: &lt;code&gt;<span class="hljs-subst">{username}</span></span></span><span>&lt;/code&gt;\n"
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"🔐 Password: <span class="hljs-subst">{<span class="hljs-string">'•'</span></span></span></span><span> * password_length}\n"
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"(Stored securely on bot)"</span></span><span>,
            parse_mode=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"HTML"</span></span><span>
        )
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> ConversationHandler.END
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🧑‍💻 No login info found.\nPlease enter your username:"</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> SET_USERNAME

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_username</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    context.user_data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>] = update.message.text
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Now enter your password:"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> SET_PASSWORD

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_password</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE</span></span><span>):
    user_id = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(update.effective_user.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">id</span></span><span>)
    username = context.user_data.get(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>)
    password = update.message.text

    data = load_user_data()
    data[user_id] = {</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>: username, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"password"</span></span><span>: password}
    save_user_data(data)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Credentials saved. Use /login to log in."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> ConversationHandler.END
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1824" data-end="1827">

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span>conv_handler = ConversationHandler(
    entry_points=[CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"login_info"</span></span><span>, login_info)],
    states={
        SET_USERNAME: [MessageHandler(filters.TEXT &amp; ~filters.COMMAND, get_username)],
        SET_PASSWORD: [MessageHandler(filters.TEXT &amp; ~filters.COMMAND, get_password)],
    },
    fallbacks=[],
)

app.add_handler(conv_handler)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="2216" data-end="2219">
<h3 data-start="2221" data-end="2232">Result:</h3>
<p data-start="2233" data-end="2264">Now <code data-start="2237" data-end="2250">/login_info</code> becomes both:</p>
<ul data-start="2265" data-end="2322">
<li data-start="2265" data-end="2292">
<p data-start="2267" data-end="2292">A viewer (if data exists)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2293" data-end="2322">
<p data-start="2295" data-end="2322">An onboarding flow (if not)</p>
</li>
</ul>

<p data-start="223" data-end="251">is <strong data-start="226" data-end="250">correct and required</strong>.</p>

<p data-start="383" data-end="469">Because <code data-start="391" data-end="412">run_in_threadpool()</code> needs a <strong data-start="421" data-end="433">function</strong>, not the result of a function call.</p>

async def login_info(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    user_id = str(update.effective_user.id)
    data = load_user_data()

    if user_id in data:
        username = data[user_id]["username"]
        password_length = len(data[user_id]["password"])
        await update.message.reply_text(
            f"🧾 &lt;b&gt;Saved Login Info:&lt;/b&gt;\n"
            f"👤 Username: &lt;code&gt;{username}&lt;/code&gt;\n"
            f"🔐 Password: {'•' * password_length}\n"
            f"(Stored securely on bot)",
            parse_mode="HTML"
        )
        return ConversationHandler.END
    else:
        await update.message.reply_text("🧑‍💻 Please enter your username:")
        return SET_USERNAME

data-scroll-anchor="false"><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT said:</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="3a8d9434-f103-4ab6-9075-1fec738e385e" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4-1-mini"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="306">Yo bro, you’re right — that block is missing the full flow after the <code data-start="69" data-end="76">else:</code> part.<br data-start="82" data-end="85">
Specifically, it <strong data-start="102" data-end="141">ends after returning <code data-start="125" data-end="139">SET_USERNAME</code></strong>, but the rest of the conversation (getting username, password, saving data) needs to be handled in <strong data-start="241" data-end="269">separate async functions</strong> tied into a <code data-start="282" data-end="303">ConversationHandler</code>.</p>
<p data-start="308" data-end="369">Your snippet is just the start of the conversation; you need:</p>
<ul data-start="371" data-end="523">
<li data-start="371" data-end="442">
<p data-start="373" data-end="442"><code data-start="373" data-end="389">get_username()</code> to receive the username input and ask for password</p>
</li>
<li data-start="443" data-end="523">
<p data-start="445" data-end="523"><code data-start="445" data-end="461">get_password()</code> to receive password input, save data, then end conversation</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="525" data-end="528">
<h3 data-start="530" data-end="700">So, that <code data-start="543" data-end="555">login_info</code> function is <strong data-start="568" data-end="585">correct as is</strong> for the start of the flow, but you must <strong data-start="626" data-end="649">define and register</strong> the other handlers for the continuation like this:</h3>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="702" data-end="1310"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_username</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update, context</span></span><span>):
    context.user_data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>] = update.message.text
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🔐 Now enter your password:"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> SET_PASSWORD

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_password</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update, context</span></span><span>):
    user_id = </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">str</span></span><span>(update.effective_user.</span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">id</span></span><span>)
    username = context.user_data.get(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>)
    password = update.message.text

    data = load_user_data()
    data[user_id] = {</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"username"</span></span><span>: username, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"password"</span></span><span>: password}
    save_user_data(data)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"✅ Credentials saved. Use /login to log in."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> ConversationHandler.END
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1312" data-end="1315">
<h3 data-start="1317" data-end="1364">Then register all in <code data-start="1342" data-end="1363">ConversationHandler</code>:</h3>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1366" data-end="1721"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center 4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copy code</button></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span>conv_handler = ConversationHandler(
    entry_points=[CommandHandler(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"login_info"</span></span><span>, login_info)],
    states={
        SET_USERNAME: [MessageHandler(filters.TEXT &amp; ~filters.COMMAND, get_username)],
        SET_PASSWORD: [MessageHandler(filters.TEXT &amp; ~filters.COMMAND, get_password)],
    },
    fallbacks=[],
)

app.add_handler(conv_handler)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1723" data-end="1726">
<p data-start="1728" data-end="1798">So your <code data-start="1736" data-end="1748">login_info</code> is the <strong data-start="1756" data-end="1771">entry point</strong>, not the whole flow alone.</p>
<hr data-start="1800" data-end="1803">
<p data-start="1805" data-end="1875" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Want me to send you the full clean snippet of all those parts bundled?</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none touch:w-[calc(100%+--spacing(3.5))] -mt-1 w-[calc(100%+--spacing(2.5))] duration-[1.5s] focus-within:transition-none hover:transition-none pointer-events-none [mask-image:linear-gradient(to_right,black_33%,transparent_66%)] [mask-size:300%_100%] [mask-position:100%_0%] motion-safe:transition-[mask-position] group-hover/turn-messages:pointer-events-auto group-hover/turn-messages:[mask-position:0_0] group-focus-within/turn-messages:pointer-events-auto group-focus-within/turn-messages:[mask-position:0_0] has-data-[state=open]:pointer-events-auto has-data-[state=open]:[mask-position:0_0]" style="mask-position: 0% 0%;"><button class="text-token-text-secondary hover:bg-token-bg-secondary rounded-lg" aria-label="Copy" aria-selected="false" data-testid="copy-turn-action-button" data-scroll-anchor="false"><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT said:</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="b0f4304c-c613-43c5-ae41-1b1f176262a9" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4-1-mini"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="15">Nope, bro! 👊</p>
<p data-start="17" data-end="133">Those <code data-start="23" data-end="30">async</code> functions like <code data-start="46" data-end="60">get_username</code> and <code data-start="65" data-end="79">get_password</code> <strong data-start="80" data-end="104">should NOT be inside</strong> the <code data-start="109" data-end="121">login_info</code> function.</p>
<p data-start="135" data-end="285">They need to be <strong data-start="151" data-end="183">separate top-level functions</strong> so the <code data-start="191" data-end="212">ConversationHandler</code> can call them when the user sends messages during the conversation flow.</p>
<hr data-start="287" data-end="290">
<p data-start="292" data-end="306"><strong data-start="292" data-end="304">Summary:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="307" data-end="499">
<li data-start="307" data-end="370">
<p data-start="309" data-end="370"><code data-start="309" data-end="321">login_info</code> starts the flow (asks for username if missing)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="371" data-end="434">
<p data-start="373" data-end="434"><code data-start="373" data-end="387">get_username</code> handles username reply and asks for password</p>
</li>
<li data-start="435" data-end="499">
<p data-start="437" data-end="499"><code data-start="437" data-end="451">get_password</code> handles password reply, saves data, ends flow</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="501" data-end="575">All defined separately, then linked together in the <code data-start="553" data-end="574">ConversationHandler</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="577" data-end="580">
<p data-start="582" data-end="639" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Want me to hook them all up for you in one clean example?</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none touch:w-[calc(100%+--spacing(3.5))] -mt-1 w-[calc(100%+--spacing(2.5))] duration-[1.5s] focus-within:transition-none hover:transition-none pointer-events-none [mask-image:linear-gradient(to_right,black_33%,transparent_66%)] [mask-size:300%_100%] [mask-position:100%_0%] <p data-start="289" data-end="347">Make sure there’s no extra indentation outside the <code data-start="340" data-end="346">else</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="349" data-end="352">
<p data-start="354" data-end="374">So the structure is:</p>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">async</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">login_info</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">update, context</span></span><span>):
    ...
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> user_id </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># show info</span></span><span>
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> ConversationHandler.END
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🧑‍💻 Please enter your username:"</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> SET_USERNAME
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="636" data-end="662">That’s the correct syntax!</p>

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">print</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"You have to complete your information first."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> login_info(update, context)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="233" data-end="410">makes perfect sense — it tells you in the console when the user needs to provide credentials and then immediately sends them into the <code data-start="367" data-end="379">login_info</code> conversation flow to fix that.</p>
<hr data-start="412" data-end="415">

class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">await</span></span><span> update.message.reply_text(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🧑‍💻 Please enter your username:"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> SET_USERNAME
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="242" data-end="350">That tells the bot to ask the user for their username and waits for their reply in the <code data-start="329" data-end="343">SET_USERNAME</code> state.</p>
<hr data-start="352" data-end="355">

data-scroll-anchor="false"><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT said:</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="fa5a9af2-942a-462d-9807-212acc056c73" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4-1-mini"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="115">After the bot sends "Please enter your username:" and returns <code data-start="62" data-end="76">SET_USERNAME</code>, it waits for the user's next message.</p>
<ol data-start="117" data-end="664">
<li data-start="117" data-end="248">
<p data-start="120" data-end="248">The next message the user sends will be handled by your <code data-start="176" data-end="190">get_username</code> async function (registered for the <code data-start="226" data-end="240">SET_USERNAME</code> state).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="250" data-end="352">
<p data-start="253" data-end="352">Inside <code data-start="260" data-end="274">get_username</code>, you save the username and prompt for the password, returning <code data-start="337" data-end="351">SET_PASSWORD</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="354" data-end="488">
<p data-start="357" data-end="488">Then the bot waits for the password input, handled by your <code data-start="416" data-end="430">get_password</code> async function (registered for the <code data-start="466" data-end="480">SET_PASSWORD</code> state).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="490" data-end="664">
<p data-start="493" data-end="664">In <code data-start="496" data-end="510">get_password</code>, you save the password, store both username and password persistently (e.g., JSON file), and end the conversation by returning <code data-start="638" data-end="663">ConversationHandler.END</code>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="666" data-end="669">
<h3 data-start="671" data-end="684">In short:</h3>
<ul data-start="686" data-end="873">
<li data-start="686" data-end="751">
<p data-start="688" data-end="751"><code data-start="688" data-end="700">login_info</code> starts the flow and asks for username if missing</p>
</li>
<li data-start="752" data-end="807">
<p data-start="754" data-end="807"><code data-start="754" data-end="768">get_username</code> receives username, asks for password</p>
</li>
<li data-start="808" data-end="873">
<p data-start="810" data-end="873"><code data-start="810" data-end="824">get_password</code> receives password, saves info, finishes the flow</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="875" data-end="878">
<p data-start="880" data-end="967" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Want me to give you the exact example code for <code data-start="927" data-end="941">get_username</code> and <code data-start="946" data-end="960">get_password</code> again?</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none touch:w-[calc(100%+--spacing(3.5))] -mt-1 w-[calc(100%+--spacing(2.5))] duration-[1.5s] focus-within:transition-none hover:transition-none pointer-events-none [mask-image:linear-gradient(to_right,black_33%,transparent_66%)] [mask-size:300%_100%] [mask-position:100%_0%] motion-safe:transition-[mask-position] group-hover/turn-messages:pointer-events-auto group-hover/turn-messages:[mask-position:0_0] group-focus-within/turn-messages:pointer-events-auto group-focus-within/turn-messages:[mask-position:0_0] has-data-[state=open]:pointer-events-auto has-data-[state=open]:[mask-position:0_0]" style="mask-position: 0% 0%;"><button class="text-token-text-secondary hover:bg-token-bg-secondary rounded-lg" aria-label="Copy" aria-selected="false" data-testid="copy-turn-action-button" data-state="closed"><span class="touch:w-10 flex h-8 w-8 items-center justify-center"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon"><path d="M12.668 10.667C12.668 9.95614 12.668 9.46258 12.6367 9.0791C12.6137 8.79732 12.5758 8.60761 12.5244 8.46387L12.4688 8.33399C12.3148 8.03193 async def get_username(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    context.user_data["username"] = update.message.text
    await update.message.reply_text("🔐 Now enter your password:")
    return SET_PASSWORD</div></div></div></div></div><div class="flex justify-end"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="43">Exactly, bro! That’s perfect for the start.</p>
<p data-start="45" data-end="237">After the user replies with their username, <code data-start="89" data-end="103">get_username</code> saves it to <code data-start="116" data-end="135">context.user_data</code> and asks for the password, then returns <code data-start="176" data-end="190">SET_PASSWORD</code> so the conversation handler knows what’s next.</p>
<p data-start="239" data-end="352">Next, you just need your <code data-start="264" data-end="278">get_password</code> function to finish the flow by saving the password and data persistently.</p>

now.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none data-scroll-anchor="false"><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT said:</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="13cb73bd-2106-40e6-9668-d9b697c62797" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="75">✅ Yes bro — <strong data-start="12" data-end="47">that’s exactly how it should be</strong> with <code data-start="53" data-end="74">ConversationHandler</code>.</p>
<p data-start="77" data-end="97">Here’s why it works:</p>
<hr data-start="99" data-end="102">
<h3 data-start="104" data-end="122">🔁 Flow Recap:</h3>
<ol data-start="124" data-end="466">
<li data-start="124" data-end="213">
<p data-start="127" data-end="213">Inside <code data-start="134" data-end="148">login_info()</code> → user not found → asks for username → <code data-start="188" data-end="209">return SET_USERNAME</code> ✅</p>
</li>
<li data-start="214" data-end="317">
<p data-start="217" data-end="317">That <code data-start="222" data-end="236">SET_USERNAME</code> tells the <code data-start="247" data-end="268">ConversationHandler</code> to wait for a message → calls <code data-start="299" data-end="315">get_username()</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="318" data-end="391">
<p data-start="321" data-end="391"><code data-start="321" data-end="337">get_username()</code> saves it, asks for password → <code data-start="368" data-end="389">return SET_PASSWORD</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="392" data-end="466">
<p data-start="395" data-end="466">Now <code data-start="399" data-end="420">ConversationHandler</code> switches to <code data-start="433" data-end="449">get_password()</code> for next message</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="468" data-end="471">
<p data-start="473" data-end="483">So having:</p>
<ul data-start="485" data-end="613">
<li data-start="485" data-end="541">
<p data-start="487" data-end="541"><code data-start="487" data-end="501">SET_USERNAME</code> returned <strong data-start="511" data-end="541">from inside <code data-start="525" data-end="539">login_info()</code></strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="542" data-end="613">
<p data-start="544" data-end="613"><code data-start="544" data-end="560">get_username()</code> and <code data-start="565" data-end="581">get_password()</code> as <strong data-start="585" data-end="613">separate async functions</strong></p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="615" data-end="683">✅ <strong data-start="617" data-end="641">Is correct and clean</strong> — you’re using the framework as intended.</p>
<p data-start="685" data-end="720" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">You're structuring it like a pro 🔥</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div <hr data-start="93" data-end="96">
<h3 data-start="98" data-end="136">🚀 Step-by-Step: Deploy to Railway</h3>
<h4 data-start="138" data-end="172">✅ 1. Create Railway Account</h4>
<ul data-start="173" data-end="257">
<li data-start="173" data-end="225">
<p data-start="175" data-end="225">Go to <a data-start="181" data-end="223" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://railway.app/">https://railway.app</a></p>
</li>
<li data-start="226" data-end="257">
<p data-start="228" data-end="257">Sign up with GitHub (easiest)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="259" data-end="262">
<h4 data-start="264" data-end="305">✅ 2. Prepare Your Bot Code Locally</h4>
<p data-start="306" data-end="332">Make sure your folder has:</p>
<ul data-start="333" data-end="451">
<li data-start="333" data-end="355">
<p data-start="335" data-end="355"><code data-start="335" data-end="344">main.py</code> (your bot)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="356" data-end="424">
<p data-start="358" data-end="424"><code data-start="358" data-end="381">user_credentials.json</code> (if already used, or Railway will make it)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="425" data-end="451">
<p data-start="427" data-end="451"><code data-start="427" data-end="445">requirements.txt</code> with:</p>
</li>
</ul>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="567" data-end="695">But note: <strong data-start="577" data-end="630">GUI stuff like Selenium+Chrome is hard on Railway</strong>, so for now just deploy the Telegram part (not the reservation).</p>
<hr data-start="697" data-end="700">
<h4 data-start="702" data-end="728">✅ 3. Push to GitHub</h4>
<ul data-start="729" data-end="823">
<li data-start="729" data-end="773">
<p data-start="731" data-end="773">Make a GitHub repo (e.g., <code data-start="757" data-end="772">reSUT_minibot</code>)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="774" data-end="823">
<p data-start="776" data-end="823">Upload your files (or use <code data-start="802" data-end="807">git</code> if you know it)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="825" data-end="828">
<h4 data-start="830" data-end="867">✅ 4. Connect GitHub to Railway</h4>
<ul data-start="868" data-end="1008">
<li data-start="868" data-end="936">
<p data-start="870" data-end="936">In Railway dashboard → “New Project” → “Deploy from GitHub Repo”</p>
</li>
<li data-start="937" data-end="955">
<p data-start="939" data-end="955">Pick your repo</p>
</li>
<li data-start="956" data-end="1008">
<p data-start="958" data-end="1008">Railway will auto-detect and run your <code data-start="996" data-end="1005">main.py</code> 🎉</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1010" data-end="1013">
<h4 data-start="1015" data-end="1051">✅ 5. Set the <code data-start="1033" data-end="1040">TOKEN</code> Securely</h4>
<p data-start="1052" data-end="1063">In Railway:</p>
<ul data-start="1064" data-end="1167">
<li data-start="1064" data-end="1096">
<p data-start="1066" data-end="1096">Go to “Settings” → “Variables”</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1097" data-end="1167">
<p data-start="1099" data-end="1167">Add: <code data-start="1104" data-end="1135">TOKEN = &lt;your_bot_token_here&gt;</code><br data-start="1135" data-end="1138">
Then change your code to use:</p>
</li>
</ul>

<hr data-start="1221" data-end="1224">
<h4 data-start="1226" data-end="1243">✅ 6. Done!</h4>
<p data-start="1244" data-end="1327">It’ll say “Deploying…” → then “Deployed”<br data-start="1284" data-end="1287">
Your bot will now run 24/7 on the cloud!</p>
<hr data-start="1329" data-end="1332">
<h3 data-start="1334" data-end="1357">⚠️ VPS Alternative?</h3>
<p data-start="1358" data-end="1583">If you need <strong data-start="1370" data-end="1399">Selenium-based automation</strong> (like Chrome opening + logging into uni site), VPS is better.<br data-start="1461" data-end="1464">
Let me know if/when you want to deploy the <strong data-start="1507" data-end="1538">full bot + reservation flow</strong> on a VPS — I’ll walk you through that too 🔧</p>

@[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="120">💯 Yes bro — that’s the first step: <strong data-start="36" data-end="66">create a GitHub repository</strong>, then you’ll <strong data-start="80" data-end="113">connect your local bot folder</strong> to it.</p>
<p data-start="122" data-end="146">Let’s go step-by-step 👇</p>
<hr data-start="148" data-end="151">
<h3 data-start="153" data-end="188">🔧 Step 1: Create a GitHub Repo</h3>
<ol data-start="190" data-end="437">
<li data-start="190" data-end="239">
<p data-start="193" data-end="239">Go to <a data-start="199" data-end="239" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://github.com/">https://github.com</a></p>
</li>
<li data-start="240" data-end="277">
<p data-start="243" data-end="277">Click <strong data-start="249" data-end="254">+</strong> → <strong data-start="257" data-end="277">"New repository"</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="278" data-end="320">
<p data-start="281" data-end="320">Name it something like: <code data-start="305" data-end="320">reSUT_minibot</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="321" data-end="371">
<p data-start="324" data-end="371">Keep it <strong data-start="332" data-end="342">Public</strong> or <strong data-start="346" data-end="357">Private</strong> (your choice)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="372" data-end="406">
<p data-start="375" data-end="406">✅ Check <strong data-start="383" data-end="406">"Add a README file"</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="407" data-end="437">
<p data-start="410" data-end="437">Click <strong data-start="416" data-end="437">Create repository</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="439" data-end="442">
<h3 data-start="444" data-end="455">✅ Done?</h3>
<p data-start="457" data-end="505">Once you do that, let me know and we’ll move to:</p>
<blockquote data-start="507" data-end="577" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">
<p data-start="509" data-end="577" data-is-last-node="">🔧 Step 2: Create your local folder and set it up to match the repo.</p>

<h3 data-start="43" data-end="86">🔧 Step 2: Set Up Your Local Bot Folder</h3>
<ol data-start="88" data-end="200">
<li data-start="88" data-end="160">
<p data-start="91" data-end="160">🗂️ On your computer, <strong data-start="113" data-end="136">create a new folder</strong> (e.g., <code data-start="144" data-end="159">reSUT_minibot</code>)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="161" data-end="200">
<p data-start="164" data-end="200">Inside that folder, add these files:</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h4 data-start="202" data-end="224">📄 1. <code data-start="213" data-end="222">main.py</code></h4>
<p data-start="225" data-end="261">This is your full Telegram bot code.</p>
<blockquote data-start="263" data-end="321">
<p data-start="265" data-end="321">Paste your working bot here — login flow, handlers, etc.</p>
</blockquote>
<hr data-start="323" data-end="326">
<h4 data-start="328" data-end="359">📄 2. <code data-start="339" data-end="357">requirements.txt</code></h4>
<p data-start="360" data-end="409">This tells Railway what libraries your bot needs.</p>
<p data-start="411" data-end="422">Paste this:</p>

<h4 data-start="542" data-end="597">📄 3. (Optional for now) <code data-start="572" data-end="595">user_credentials.json</code></h4>
